text: Dukat is a community of the Vlorë County, southern Albania. At the 2015 local government reform it became part of the municipality Vlorë. ==History== ===World War II=== During World War II Dukat was part of the battlefield of the battle of Gjorm, where Albanian resistance units defeated and routed the troops of the Kingdom of Italy. ==Demographics== Dukat is mixed, inhabited 73% by Orthodox Christians and 21% by Muslims and the whole village speaks Albanian. "Dukat, which is majority Christian and minority Mohammedan, but entirely Albanian in speech" It is home to the Church of Marmiroi, a medieval church. ==References== ==External links== Category:Populated places in Vlorë
title: Dukat, Albania
